meanings.definition: To surpass in a competition or comparison.
meanings.sent1: She was outvying her classmates in the spelling bee.
meanings.sent2: The athlete trained hard to ensure he was outvying his opponents.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was outvying the birds for the last acorn in the tree.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was outvying any obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The sun outvying the moon in brightness, lighting up the night sky.

meanings.definition: To outdo or outperform someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The chef was outvying himself with each new dish he created.
meanings.sent2: The student was outvying his own previous test scores with each exam.
meanings.sent3: The cat was outvying the dog in a playful game of chase around the yard.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was outvying any material gifts she could offer.
meanings.sent5: The flowers in her garden were outvying each other in beauty, creating a colorful display.
